children.text: The drawings we have been provided with show the approximate dimensions of the wet areas where there are pipe locations, such as bathroom and kitchen waste pipes etc, which we have check measured, and can confirm that it closely matches what has been documented on the drawings.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 2.03 Setting out the site states that
‘A building set out is defective where the set out has failed to comply with the requirements of the approved drawings’
, and clause 2.06 Building dimensions states that

‘Departures from the documented set out for habitable rooms and areas, such as bedrooms, dining rooms, lounge and living rooms, family rooms, studies, halls, entries and stairways are defects if they exceed L/100 or 5 mm, whichever is the greater, where L is the documented dimension’ .

This item is to confirm that the pipe locations are correct (within the allowable tolerances), and there is no action required from the builder at this stage in relation to this issue. Once the wall frames have been installed, we will be able to check more accurately if there are any plumbing pipe location issues, which can be easily addressed at that stage.
